meanings.definition: Having minute hairs or projections on the edge, as certain leaves.
meanings.sent1: The ciliate leaf looked fuzzy along its edges.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar had a ciliate body, making it appear soft and delicate.
meanings.sent3: The ciliate plant seemed to be wearing a tiny jacket of hair.
meanings.sent4: Her ciliate scarf fluttered in the wind like a tiny forest.
meanings.sent5: The ciliate texture of the fabric felt like a gentle brush against the skin.

meanings.definition: Any of various protozoans of the phylum Ciliophora, characterized by cilia covering the cell surface.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the ciliate moved gracefully with its tiny hairs.
meanings.sent2: The pond water was teeming with ciliates swimming around.
meanings.sent3: The ciliate party in the petri dish seemed to be dancing to their own beat.
meanings.sent4: The ciliate community worked together like a synchronized swimming team.
meanings.sent5: Observing the ciliate under the lens revealed a bustling city of tiny beings.
